title: How to Grill Pork Chops

methods.name: Grilled Pork Loins with Soy Sauce

steps.headline: Combine all marinade ingredients in a deep bowl.
steps.description: Submerge the loin chops, cover, and allow to marinate for 2-3 hours in the refrigerator.

steps.headline: Preheat a grill to medium-high heat.
steps.description: Remove the pork loins from the marinade and grill each side of the meat for 6-7 minutes. Pork should be browned and have grill marks when finished.

steps.headline: Transfer the pork chops to a serving dish.
steps.description: Serve immediately with salad, rice, or other side dish.

steps.headline: Combine the water, beer, salt, sugar, and molasses in a large bowl.
steps.description: Stir the mixture until the salt and sugar dissolve, then add the ice.

steps.headline: Place the pork chops in a large plastic resealable bag.
steps.description: Pour the beer brine over the pork chops and allow to marinate in the refrigerator for 3-4 hours. Turn the bag over occasionally.

steps.headline: Heat a grill over medium-high heat.
steps.description: In a small bowl, mix together the garlic, sage, salt and pepper. Remove the pork chops from the bag, rub them dry, and then coat them in the garlic rub mixture.

steps.headline: Grill each pork chop for about 10 minutes on each side.
steps.description: Transfer to a serving dish and serve immediately.

methods.name: Grilled Pork Chops with Spicy Rub

steps.headline: Combine the dry ingredients in a small bowl.
steps.description: Coat each pork chop generously with the rub, place them in a plastic resealable bag, and refrigerate for 4-6 hours.

steps.headline: Preheat a grill to medium heat.
steps.description: Remove the chops from the plastic bag and let them sit at room temperature, covered, for about 20 minutes.

steps.headline: Oil the grill to prevent the meat from sticking.
steps.description: Grill each pork chop for 18-20 minutes, turning them over halfway through. The chops should have grill marks and be only slightly pink at the center when finished.

steps.headline: Transfer the pork chops to a serving dish.

text: Grilled Pork Loins with Soy Sauce Combine all marinade ingredients in a deep bowl. Submerge the loin chops, cover, and allow to marinate for 2-3 hours in the refrigerator. Preheat a grill to medium-high heat. Remove the pork loins from the marinade and grill each side of the meat for 6-7 minutes. Pork should be browned and have grill marks when finished. Transfer the pork chops to a serving dish. Serve immediately with salad, rice, or other side dish. Beer-Brined Pork Chops Combine the water, beer, salt, sugar, and molasses in a large bowl. Stir the mixture until the salt and sugar dissolve, then add the ice. Place the pork chops in a large plastic resealable bag. Pour the beer brine over the pork chops and allow to marinate in the refrigerator for 3-4 hours. Turn the bag over occasionally. Heat a grill over medium-high heat. In a small bowl, mix together the garlic, sage, salt and pepper. Remove the pork chops from the bag, rub them dry, and then coat them in the garlic rub mixture. Grill each pork chop for about 10 minutes on each side. Transfer to a serving dish and serve immediately. Grilled Pork Chops with Spicy Rub Combine the dry ingredients in a small bowl. Coat each pork chop generously with the rub, place them in a plastic resealable bag, and refrigerate for 4-6 hours. Preheat a grill to medium heat. Remove the chops from the plastic bag and let them sit at room temperature, covered, for about 20 minutes. Oil the grill to prevent the meat from sticking. Grill each pork chop for 18-20 minutes, turning them over halfway through. The chops should have grill marks and be only slightly pink at the center when finished. Transfer the pork chops to a serving dish. Serve immediately and enjoy!
